intro: Koeleria phleoides var. azorensis, commonly known as the Azorean grass, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with minute florets. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
